content_html: The Burns Lake Community Garden Society is planning a community open house for late summer or early fall to showcase the garden and give back to local residents. “We want it to be an open house, open to all members of the community,” said board chair Brittany Evans. “We’re hoping to have a barbecue.” While no exact date has been set, Evans said the event will likely take place during harvest season and will be promoted in advance. The event is not intended as a fundraiser, but as a way to connect with the public. “We just want to really be able to showcase and give back to the community in the way that they give to us,” Evans said. “All of the money that we have is either from fundraising or community donations… otherwise we wouldn’t be able to run and organize the space.” Burns Lake community garden members work to prepare the space for the growing season in May, 2025.
